00029 #include <stdio.h>
00030 #include <stdlib.h>
00031 #include <string.h>
00032 #include <limits.h>

00034 #include "DNA_mesh_types.h"

00042 #include "BLI_utildefines.h"

00051 #define SELECT 1
00052 
00053 /* Used to detect polys (faces) using exactly the same vertices. */
00054 /* Used to detect loops used by no (disjoint) or more than one (intersect) polys. */
00055 typedef struct SortPoly {
00056     int *verts;
00057     int numverts;
00058     int loopstart;
00059     unsigned int index;
00060     int invalid; /* Poly index. */
00061 } SortPoly;
00062 
00063 /* TODO check there is not some standard define of this somewhere! */
00064 static int int_cmp(const void *v1, const void *v2)
00065 {
00066     return *(int *)v1 > *(int *)v2 ? 1 : *(int *)v1 < *(int *)v2 ? -1 : 0;
00067 }
00068 
00069 static int search_poly_cmp(const void *v1, const void *v2)
00070 {
00071     const SortPoly *sp1 = v1, *sp2 = v2;
00072     const int max_idx = sp1->numverts > sp2->numverts ? sp2->numverts : sp1->numverts;
00073     int idx = 0;
00074 
00075     /* Reject all invalid polys at end of list! */
00076     if (sp1->invalid || sp2->invalid)
00077         return sp1->invalid && sp2->invalid ? 0 : sp1->invalid ? 1 : -1;
00078     /* Else, sort on first non-egal verts (remember verts of valid polys are sorted). */
00079     while (idx < max_idx && sp1->verts[idx] == sp2->verts[idx])
00080         idx++;
00081     return sp1->verts[idx] > sp2->verts[idx] ? 1 : sp1->verts[idx] < sp2->verts[idx] ? -1 :
00082            sp1->numverts > sp2->numverts ? 1 : sp1->numverts < sp2->numverts ? -1 : 0;
00083 }
00084 
00085 static int search_polyloop_cmp(const void *v1, const void *v2)
00086 {
00087     const SortPoly *sp1 = v1, *sp2 = v2;
00088 
00089     /* Reject all invalid polys at end of list! */
00090     if (sp1->invalid || sp2->invalid)
00091         return sp1->invalid && sp2->invalid ? 0 : sp1->invalid ? 1 : -1;
00092     /* Else, sort on loopstart. */
00093     return sp1->loopstart > sp2->loopstart ? 1 : sp1->loopstart < sp2->loopstart ? -1 : 0;
00094 }
00095 
00096 #define PRINT if (do_verbose) printf
00097 
00098 int BKE_mesh_validate_arrays(Mesh *mesh,
00099                              MVert *mverts, unsigned int totvert,
00100                              MEdge *medges, unsigned int totedge,
00101                              MLoop *mloops, unsigned int totloop,
00102                              MPoly *mpolys, unsigned int totpoly,
00103                              MDeformVert *dverts, /* assume totvert length */
00104                              const short do_verbose, const short do_fixes)
00105 {
00106 #   define REMOVE_EDGE_TAG(_me) { _me->v2 = _me->v1; do_edge_free = TRUE; }
00107 #   define IS_REMOVED_EDGE(_me) (_me->v2 == _me->v1)
00108 
00109 #   define REMOVE_LOOP_TAG(_ml) { _ml->e = INVALID_LOOP_EDGE_MARKER; do_polyloop_free = TRUE; }
00110 #   define REMOVE_POLY_TAG(_mp) { _mp->totloop *= -1; do_polyloop_free = TRUE; }
00111 
00112     MVert *mv = mverts;
00113     MEdge *me;
00114     MLoop *ml;
00115     MPoly *mp;
00116     unsigned int i, j;
00117     int *v;
00118 
00119     short do_edge_free = FALSE;
00120     short do_polyloop_free = FALSE; /* This regroups loops and polys! */
00121 
00122     short verts_fixed = FALSE;
00123     short vert_weights_fixed = FALSE;
00124 
00125     int do_edge_recalc = FALSE;
00126 
00127     EdgeHash *edge_hash = BLI_edgehash_new();
00128 
00129     BLI_assert(!(do_fixes && mesh == NULL));
00130 
00131     PRINT("%s: verts(%u), edges(%u), loops(%u), polygons(%u)\n",
00132           __func__, totvert, totedge, totloop, totpoly);
00133 
00134     if (totedge == 0 && totpoly != 0) {
00135         PRINT("    logical error, %u polygons and 0 edges\n", totpoly);
00136         do_edge_recalc = do_fixes;
00137     }
00138 
00139     for (i = 1; i < totvert; i++, mv++) {
00140         int j;
00141         int fix_normal = TRUE;
00142 
00143         for (j = 0; j < 3; j++) {
00144             if (!finite(mv->co[j])) {
00145                 PRINT("    vertex %u: has invalid coordinate\n", i);
00146 
00147                 if (do_fixes) {
00148                     zero_v3(mv->co);
00149 
00150                     verts_fixed = TRUE;
00151                 }
00152             }
00153 
00154             if (mv->no[j] != 0)
00155                 fix_normal = FALSE;
00156         }
00157 
00158         if (fix_normal) {
00159             PRINT("    vertex %u: has zero normal, assuming Z-up normal\n", i);
00160             if (do_fixes) {
00161                 mv->no[2] = SHRT_MAX;
00162                 verts_fixed = TRUE;
00163             }
00164         }
00165     }
00166 
00167     for (i = 0, me = medges; i < totedge; i++, me++) {
00168         int remove = FALSE;
00169         if (me->v1 == me->v2) {
00170             PRINT("    edge %u: has matching verts, both %u\n", i, me->v1);
00171             remove = do_fixes;
00172         }
00173         if (me->v1 >= totvert) {
00174             PRINT("    edge %u: v1 index out of range, %u\n", i, me->v1);
00175             remove = do_fixes;
00176         }
00177         if (me->v2 >= totvert) {
00178             PRINT("    edge %u: v2 index out of range, %u\n", i, me->v2);
00179             remove = do_fixes;
00180         }
00181 
00182         if (BLI_edgehash_haskey(edge_hash, me->v1, me->v2)) {
00183             PRINT("    edge %u: is a duplicate of %d\n", i,
00184                   GET_INT_FROM_POINTER(BLI_edgehash_lookup(edge_hash, me->v1, me->v2)));
00185             remove = do_fixes;
00186         }
00187 
00188         if (remove == FALSE) {
00189             BLI_edgehash_insert(edge_hash, me->v1, me->v2, SET_INT_IN_POINTER(i));
00190         }
00191         else {
00192             REMOVE_EDGE_TAG(me);
00193         }
00194     }
00195 
00196     /* Checking loops and polys is a bit tricky, as they are quite intricated...
00197      *
00198      * Polys must have:
00199      * - a valid loopstart value.
00200      * - a valid totloop value (>= 3 and loopstart+totloop < me.totloop).
00201      *
00202      * Loops must have:
00203      * - a valid v value.
00204      * - a valid e value (corresponding to the edge it defines with the next loop in poly).
00205      *
00206      * Also, loops not used by polys can be discarded.
00207      * And "intersecting" loops (i.e. loops used by more than one poly) are invalid,
00208      * so be sure to leave at most one poly/loop!
00209      */
00210     {
00211         SortPoly *sort_polys = MEM_callocN(sizeof(SortPoly) * totpoly, "mesh validate's sort_polys");
00212         SortPoly *prev_sp, *sp = sort_polys;
00213         int prev_end;
00214         for (i = 0, mp = mpolys; i < totpoly; i++, mp++, sp++) {
00215             sp->index = i;
00216 
00217             if (mp->loopstart < 0 || mp->totloop < 3) {
00218                 /* Invalid loop data. */
00219                 PRINT("    poly %u is invalid (loopstart: %u, totloop: %u)\n", sp->index, mp->loopstart, mp->totloop);
00220                 sp->invalid = TRUE;
00221             }
00222             else if (mp->loopstart + mp->totloop > totloop) {
00223                 /* Invalid loop data. */
00224                 PRINT("    poly %u uses loops out of range (loopstart: %u, loopend: %u, max nbr of loops: %u)\n",
00225                       sp->index, mp->loopstart, mp->loopstart + mp->totloop - 1, totloop - 1);
00226                 sp->invalid = TRUE;
00227             }
00228             else {
00229                 /* Poly itself is valid, for now. */
00230                 int v1, v2; /* v1 is prev loop vert idx, v2 is current loop one. */
00231                 sp->invalid = FALSE;
00232                 sp->verts = v = MEM_mallocN(sizeof(int) * mp->totloop, "Vert idx of SortPoly");
00233                 sp->numverts = mp->totloop;
00234                 sp->loopstart = mp->loopstart;
00235 
00236                 /* Test all poly's loops' vert idx. */
00237                 for (j = 0, ml = &mloops[sp->loopstart]; j < mp->totloop; j++, ml++, v++) {
00238                     if (ml->v >= totvert) {
00239                         /* Invalid vert idx. */
00240                         PRINT("    loop %u has invalid vert reference (%u)\n", sp->loopstart + j, ml->v);
00241                         sp->invalid = TRUE;
00242                     }
00243 
00244                     mverts[ml->v].flag |= ME_VERT_TMP_TAG;
00245                     *v = ml->v;
00246                 }
00247 
00248                 /* is the same vertex used more then once */
00249                 if (!sp->invalid) {
00250                     v = sp->verts;
00251                     for (j = 0; j < mp->totloop; j++, v++) {
00252                         if ((mverts[*v].flag & ME_VERT_TMP_TAG) == 0) {
00253                             PRINT("    poly %u has duplicate vert reference at corner (%u)\n", i, j);
00254                             sp->invalid = TRUE;
00255                         }
00256                         mverts[*v].flag &= ~ME_VERT_TMP_TAG;
00257                     }
00258                 }
00259 
00260                 if (sp->invalid)
00261                     continue;
00262 
00263                 /* Test all poly's loops. */
00264                 for (j = 0, ml = &mloops[sp->loopstart]; j < mp->totloop; j++, ml++) {
00265                     v1 = ml->v;
00266                     v2 = mloops[sp->loopstart + (j + 1) % mp->totloop].v;
00267                     if (!BLI_edgehash_haskey(edge_hash, v1, v2)) {
00268                         /* Edge not existing. */
00269                         PRINT("    poly %u needs missing edge (%u, %u)\n", sp->index, v1, v2);
00270                         if (do_fixes)
00271                             do_edge_recalc = TRUE;
00272                         else
00273                             sp->invalid = TRUE;
00274                     }
00275                     else if (ml->e >= totedge) {
00276                         /* Invalid edge idx.
00277                          * We already know from previous text that a valid edge exists, use it (if allowed)! */
00278                         if (do_fixes) {
00279                             int prev_e = ml->e;
00280                             ml->e = GET_INT_FROM_POINTER(BLI_edgehash_lookup(edge_hash, v1, v2));
00281                             PRINT("    loop %u has invalid edge reference (%u), fixed using edge %u\n",
00282                                   sp->loopstart + j, prev_e, ml->e);
00283                         }
00284                         else {
00285                             PRINT("    loop %u has invalid edge reference (%u)\n", sp->loopstart + j, ml->e);
00286                             sp->invalid = TRUE;
00287                         }
00288                     }
00289                     else {
00290                         me = &medges[ml->e];
00291                         if (IS_REMOVED_EDGE(me) || !((me->v1 == v1 && me->v2 == v2) || (me->v1 == v2 && me->v2 == v1))) {
00292                             /* The pointed edge is invalid (tagged as removed, or vert idx mismatch),
00293                              * and we already know from previous test that a valid one exists, use it (if allowed)! */
00294                             if (do_fixes) {
00295                                 int prev_e = ml->e;
00296                                 ml->e = GET_INT_FROM_POINTER(BLI_edgehash_lookup(edge_hash, v1, v2));
00297                                 PRINT("    poly %u has invalid edge reference (%u), fixed using edge %u\n",
00298                                       sp->index, prev_e, ml->e);
00299                             }
00300                             else {
00301                                 PRINT("    poly %u has invalid edge reference (%u)\n", sp->index, ml->e);
00302                                 sp->invalid = TRUE;
00303                             }
00304                         }
00305                     }
00306                 }
00307 
00308                 /* Now check that that poly does not use a same vertex more than once! */
00309                 if (!sp->invalid) {
00310                     int *prev_v = v = sp->verts;
00311                     j = sp->numverts;
00312 
00313                     qsort(sp->verts, j, sizeof(int), int_cmp);
00314 
00315                     for (j--, v++; j; j--, v++) {
00316                         if (*v != *prev_v) {
00317                             int dlt = v - prev_v;
00318                             if (dlt > 1) {
00319                                 PRINT("    poly %u is invalid, it multi-uses vertex %u (%u times)\n",
00320                                       sp->index, *prev_v, dlt);
00321                                 sp->invalid = TRUE;
00322                             }
00323                             prev_v = v;
00324                         }
00325                     }
00326                     if (v - prev_v > 1) { /* Don't forget final verts! */
00327                         PRINT("    poly %u is invalid, it multi-uses vertex %u (%u times)\n",
00328                               sp->index, *prev_v, (int)(v - prev_v));
00329                         sp->invalid = TRUE;
00330                     }
00331                 }
00332             
00333             }
00334         }
00335 
00336         /* Second check pass, testing polys using the same verts. */
00337         qsort(sort_polys, totpoly, sizeof(SortPoly), search_poly_cmp);
00338         sp = prev_sp = sort_polys;
00339         sp++;
00340 
00341         for (i = 1; i < totpoly; i++, sp++) {
00342             int p1_nv = sp->numverts, p2_nv = prev_sp->numverts;
00343             int *p1_v = sp->verts, *p2_v = prev_sp->verts;
00344             short p1_sub = TRUE, p2_sub = TRUE;
00345             if (sp->invalid)
00346                 break;
00347             /* Test same polys. */
00348 #if 0
00349             /* NOTE: This performs a sub-set test. */
00350             /* XXX This (and the sort of verts list) is better than systematic
00351              *     search of all verts of one list into the other if lists have
00352              *     a fair amount of elements.
00353              *     Not sure however it's worth it in this case?
00354              *     But as we also need sorted vert list to check verts multi-used
00355              *     (in first pass of checks)... */
00356             /* XXX If we consider only "equal" polys (i.e. using exactly same set of verts)
00357              *     as invalid, better to replace this by a simple memory cmp... */
00358             while ((p1_nv && p2_nv) && (p1_sub || p2_sub)) {
00359                 if (*p1_v < *p2_v) {
00360                     if (p1_sub)
00361                         p1_sub = FALSE;
00362                     p1_nv--;
00363                     p1_v++;
00364                 }
00365                 else if (*p2_v < *p1_v) {
00366                     if (p2_sub)
00367                         p2_sub = FALSE;
00368                     p2_nv--;
00369                     p2_v++;
00370                 }
00371                 else {
00372                     /* Equality, both next verts. */
00373                     p1_nv--;
00374                     p2_nv--;
00375                     p1_v++;
00376                     p2_v++;
00377                 }
00378             }
00379             if (p1_nv && p1_sub)
00380                 p1_sub = FALSE;
00381             else if (p2_nv && p2_sub)
00382                 p2_sub = FALSE;
00383 
00384             if (p1_sub && p2_sub) {
00385                 PRINT("    polys %u and %u use same vertices, considering poly %u as invalid.\n",
00386                       prev_sp->index, sp->index, sp->index);
00387                 sp->invalid = TRUE;
00388             }
00389             /* XXX In fact, these might be valid? :/ */
00390             else if (p1_sub) {
00391                 PRINT("    %u is a sub-poly of %u, considering it as invalid.\n", sp->index, prev_sp->index);
00392                 sp->invalid = TRUE;
00393             }
00394             else if (p2_sub) {
00395                 PRINT("    %u is a sub-poly of %u, considering it as invalid.\n", prev_sp->index, sp->index);
00396                 prev_sp->invalid = TRUE;
00397                 prev_sp = sp; /* sp is new reference poly. */
00398             }
00399 #else
00400             if (0) {
00401                 p1_sub += 0;
00402                 p2_sub += 0;
00403             }
00404             if ((p1_nv == p2_nv) && (memcmp(p1_v, p2_v, p1_nv * sizeof(*p1_v)) == 0)) {
00405                 if (do_verbose) {
00406                     PRINT("    polys %u and %u use same vertices (%u",
00407                           prev_sp->index, sp->index, *p1_v);
00408                     for (j = 1; j < p1_nv; j++)
00409                         PRINT(", %u", p1_v[j]);
00410                     PRINT("), considering poly %u as invalid.\n", sp->index);
00411                 }
00412                 sp->invalid = TRUE;
00413             }
00414 #endif
00415             else {
00416                 prev_sp = sp;
00417             }
00418         }
00419 
00420         /* Third check pass, testing loops used by none or more than one poly. */
00421         qsort(sort_polys, totpoly, sizeof(SortPoly), search_polyloop_cmp);
00422         sp = sort_polys;
00423         prev_sp = NULL;
00424         prev_end = 0;
00425         for (i = 0; i < totpoly; i++, sp++) {
00426             /* Free this now, we don't need it anymore, and avoid us another loop! */
00427             if (sp->verts)
00428                 MEM_freeN(sp->verts);
00429 
00430             /* Note above prev_sp: in following code, we make sure it is always valid poly (or NULL). */
00431             if (sp->invalid) {
00432                 if (do_fixes) {
00433                     REMOVE_POLY_TAG((&mpolys[sp->index]));
00434                     /* DO NOT REMOVE ITS LOOPS!!!
00435                      * As already invalid polys are at the end of the SortPoly list, the loops they
00436                      * were the only users have already been tagged as "to remove" during previous
00437                      * iterations, and we don't want to remove some loops that may be used by
00438                      * another valid poly! */
00439                 }
00440             }
00441             /* Test loops users. */
00442             else {
00443                 /* Unused loops. */
00444                 if (prev_end < sp->loopstart) {
00445                     for (j = prev_end, ml = &mloops[prev_end]; j < sp->loopstart; j++, ml++) {
00446                         PRINT("    loop %u is unused.\n", j);
00447                         if (do_fixes)
00448                             REMOVE_LOOP_TAG(ml);
00449                     }
00450                     prev_end = sp->loopstart + sp->numverts;
00451                     prev_sp = sp;
00452                 }
00453                 /* Multi-used loops. */
00454                 else if (prev_end > sp->loopstart) {
00455                     PRINT("    polys %u and %u share loops from %u to %u, considering poly %u as invalid.\n",
00456                           prev_sp->index, sp->index, sp->loopstart, prev_end, sp->index);
00457                     if (do_fixes) {
00458                         REMOVE_POLY_TAG((&mpolys[sp->index]));
00459                         /* DO NOT REMOVE ITS LOOPS!!!
00460                          * They might be used by some next, valid poly!
00461                          * Just not updating prev_end/prev_sp vars is enough to ensure the loops
00462                          * effectively no more needed will be marked as "to be removed"! */
00463                     }
00464                 }
00465                 else {
00466                     prev_end = sp->loopstart + sp->numverts;
00467                     prev_sp = sp;
00468                 }
00469             }
00470         }
00471         /* We may have some remaining unused loops to get rid of! */
00472         if (prev_end < totloop) {
00473             for (j = prev_end, ml = &mloops[prev_end]; j < totloop; j++, ml++) {
00474                 PRINT("    loop %u is unused.\n", j);
00475                 if (do_fixes)
00476                     REMOVE_LOOP_TAG(ml);
00477             }
00478         }
00479 
00480         MEM_freeN(sort_polys);
00481     }
00482 
00483     BLI_edgehash_free(edge_hash, NULL);
00484 
00485     /* fix deform verts */
00486     if (dverts) {
00487         MDeformVert *dv;
00488         for (i = 0, dv = dverts; i < totvert; i++, dv++) {
00489             MDeformWeight *dw;
00490             unsigned int j;
00491 
00492             for (j = 0, dw = dv->dw; j < dv->totweight; j++, dw++) {
00493                 /* note, greater then max defgroups is accounted for in our code, but not < 0 */
00494                 if (!finite(dw->weight)) {
00495                     PRINT("    vertex deform %u, group %d has weight: %f\n", i, dw->def_nr, dw->weight);
00496                     if (do_fixes) {
00497                         dw->weight = 0.0f;
00498                         vert_weights_fixed = TRUE;
00499                     }
00500                 }
00501                 else if (dw->weight < 0.0f || dw->weight > 1.0f) {
00502                     PRINT("    vertex deform %u, group %d has weight: %f\n", i, dw->def_nr, dw->weight);
00503                     if (do_fixes) {
00504                         CLAMP(dw->weight, 0.0f, 1.0f);
00505                         vert_weights_fixed = TRUE;
00506                     }
00507                 }
00508 
00509                 if (dw->def_nr < 0) {
00510                     PRINT("    vertex deform %u, has invalid group %d\n", i, dw->def_nr);
00511                     if (do_fixes) {
00512                         defvert_remove_group(dv, dw);
00513                         if (dv->dw) {
00514                             /* re-allocated, the new values compensate for stepping
00515                              * within the for loop and may not be valid */
00516                             j--;
00517                             dw = dv->dw + j;
00518 
00519                             vert_weights_fixed = TRUE;
00520                         }
00521                         else { /* all freed */
00522                             break;
00523                         }
00524                     }
00525                 }
00526             }
00527         }
00528     }
00529 
00530     PRINT("BKE_mesh_validate: finished\n\n");
00531 
00532 #   undef REMOVE_EDGE_TAG
00533 #   undef IS_REMOVED_EDGE
00534 #   undef REMOVE_LOOP_TAG
00535 #   undef REMOVE_POLY_TAG
00536 
00537     if (mesh) {
00538         if (do_polyloop_free) {
00539             mesh_strip_loose_polysloops(mesh);
00540         }
00541 
00542         if (do_edge_free) {
00543             mesh_strip_loose_edges(mesh);
00544         }
00545 
00546         if (do_edge_recalc) {
00547             BKE_mesh_calc_edges(mesh, TRUE);
00548         }
00549     }
00550 
00551     return (verts_fixed || vert_weights_fixed || do_polyloop_free || do_edge_free || do_edge_recalc);
00552 }
00553 
00554 static int mesh_validate_customdata(CustomData *data, short do_verbose, const short do_fixes)
00555 {
00556     int i = 0, has_fixes = 0;
00557 
00558     while (i < data->totlayer) {
00559         CustomDataLayer *layer = &data->layers[i];
00560         CustomDataMask mask = CD_TYPE_AS_MASK(layer->type);
00561         int ok = 1;
00562 
00563         if ((mask & CD_MASK_MESH) == 0) {
00564             PRINT("CustomDataLayer type %d which isn't in CD_MASK_MESH is stored in Mehs structure\n", layer->type);
00565 
00566             if (do_fixes) {
00567                 CustomData_free_layer(data, layer->type, 0, i);
00568                 ok = 0;
00569                 has_fixes = 1;
00570             }
00571         }
00572 
00573         if (ok)
00574             i++;
00575     }
00576 
00577     return has_fixes;
00578 }
00579 
00580 #undef PRINT
00581 
00582 static int BKE_mesh_validate_all_customdata(CustomData *vdata, CustomData *edata,
00583                                             CustomData *ldata, CustomData *pdata,
00584                                             short do_verbose, const short do_fixes)
00585 {
00586     int vfixed = 0, efixed = 0, lfixed = 0, pfixed = 0;
00587 
00588     vfixed = mesh_validate_customdata(vdata, do_verbose, do_fixes);
00589     efixed = mesh_validate_customdata(edata, do_verbose, do_fixes);
00590     lfixed = mesh_validate_customdata(ldata, do_verbose, do_fixes);
00591     pfixed = mesh_validate_customdata(pdata, do_verbose, do_fixes);
00592 
00593     return vfixed || efixed || lfixed || pfixed;
00594 }
00595 
00596 int BKE_mesh_validate(Mesh *me, int do_verbose)
00597 {
00598     int layers_fixed = 0, arrays_fixed = 0;
00599 
00600     if (do_verbose) {
00601         printf("MESH: %s\n", me->id.name + 2);
00602     }
00603 
00604     layers_fixed = BKE_mesh_validate_all_customdata(&me->vdata, &me->edata, &me->ldata, &me->pdata, do_verbose, TRUE);
00605     arrays_fixed = BKE_mesh_validate_arrays(me,
00606                                             me->mvert, me->totvert,
00607                                             me->medge, me->totedge,
00608                                             me->mloop, me->totloop,
00609                                             me->mpoly, me->totpoly,
00610                                             me->dvert,
00611                                             do_verbose, TRUE);
00612 
00613     if (layers_fixed || arrays_fixed) {
00614         DAG_id_tag_update(&me->id, OB_RECALC_DATA);
00615         return TRUE;
00616     }
00617     return FALSE;
00618 }
00619 
00620 int BKE_mesh_validate_dm(DerivedMesh *dm)
00621 {
00622     return BKE_mesh_validate_arrays(NULL,
00623                                     dm->getVertArray(dm), dm->getNumVerts(dm),
00624                                     dm->getEdgeArray(dm), dm->getNumEdges(dm),
00625                                     dm->getLoopArray(dm), dm->getNumLoops(dm),
00626                                     dm->getPolyArray(dm), dm->getNumPolys(dm),
00627                                     dm->getVertDataArray(dm, CD_MDEFORMVERT),
00628                                     TRUE, FALSE);
00629 }
00630 
00631 void BKE_mesh_calc_edges(Mesh *mesh, int update)
00632 {
00633     CustomData edata;
00634     EdgeHashIterator *ehi;
00635     MPoly *mp = mesh->mpoly;
00636     MEdge *med, *med_orig;
00637     EdgeHash *eh = BLI_edgehash_new();
00638     int i, totedge, totpoly = mesh->totpoly;
00639     int med_index;
00640 
00641     if (mesh->totedge == 0)
00642         update = FALSE;
00643 
00644     if (update) {
00645         /* assume existing edges are valid
00646          * useful when adding more faces and generating edges from them */
00647         med = mesh->medge;
00648         for (i = 0; i < mesh->totedge; i++, med++)
00649             BLI_edgehash_insert(eh, med->v1, med->v2, med);
00650     }
00651 
00652     /* mesh loops (bmesh only) */
00653     for (i = 0; i < totpoly; i++, mp++) {
00654         MLoop *l = &mesh->mloop[mp->loopstart];
00655         int j, l_prev = (l + (mp->totloop - 1))->v;
00656         for (j = 0; j < mp->totloop; j++, l++) {
00657             if (!BLI_edgehash_haskey(eh, l_prev, l->v)) {
00658                 BLI_edgehash_insert(eh, l_prev, l->v, NULL);
00659             }
00660             l_prev = l->v;
00661         }
00662     }
00663 
00664     totedge = BLI_edgehash_size(eh);
00665 
00666     /* write new edges into a temporary CustomData */
00667     memset(&edata, 0, sizeof(edata));
00668     CustomData_add_layer(&edata, CD_MEDGE, CD_CALLOC, NULL, totedge);
00669 
00670     ehi = BLI_edgehashIterator_new(eh);
00671     med = CustomData_get_layer(&edata, CD_MEDGE);
00672     for (i = 0; !BLI_edgehashIterator_isDone(ehi);
00673          BLI_edgehashIterator_step(ehi), ++i, ++med) {
00674 
00675         if (update && (med_orig = BLI_edgehashIterator_getValue(ehi))) {
00676             *med = *med_orig; /* copy from the original */
00677         }
00678         else {
00679             BLI_edgehashIterator_getKey(ehi, &med->v1, &med->v2);
00680             med->flag = ME_EDGEDRAW | ME_EDGERENDER | SELECT; /* select for newly created meshes which are selected [#25595] */
00681         }
00682 
00683         /* store the new edge index in the hash value */
00684         BLI_edgehashIterator_setValue(ehi, SET_INT_IN_POINTER(i));
00685     }
00686     BLI_edgehashIterator_free(ehi);
00687 
00688     if (mesh->totpoly) {
00689         /* second pass, iterate through all loops again and assign
00690          * the newly created edges to them. */
00691         MPoly *mp = mesh->mpoly;
00692         for (i = 0; i < mesh->totpoly; i++, mp++) {
00693             MLoop *l = &mesh->mloop[mp->loopstart];
00694             MLoop *l_prev = (l + (mp->totloop - 1));
00695             int j;
00696             for (j = 0; j < mp->totloop; j++, l++) {
00697                 /* lookup hashed edge index */
00698                 med_index = GET_INT_FROM_POINTER(BLI_edgehash_lookup(eh, l_prev->v, l->v));
00699                 l_prev->e = med_index;
00700                 l_prev = l;
00701             }
00702         }
00703     }
00704 
00705     /* free old CustomData and assign new one */
00706     CustomData_free(&mesh->edata, mesh->totedge);
00707     mesh->edata = edata;
00708     mesh->totedge = totedge;
00709 
00710     mesh->medge = CustomData_get_layer(&mesh->edata, CD_MEDGE);
00711 
00712     BLI_edgehash_free(eh, NULL);
00713 }
